senses.synonym: 10667676-n (someone who takes the place of another (as when things get dangerous or difficult); \""the star had a stand-in for dangerous scenes\""; \""we need extra employees for summer fill-ins\""

relations.target: double=00133576-n (a base hit on which the batter stops safely at second base; \""he hit a double to deep centerfield\"");00805055-n (raising the stakes in a card game by a factor of 2; \""I decided his double was a bluff\"");05868784-n (a quantity that is twice as great as another; \""36 is the double of 18\"");10046971-n (someone who closely resembles a famous person (especially an actor); \""he could be Gingrich's double\""; \""she's the very image of her mother\"");10686285-n (a stand-in for movie stars to perform dangerous stunts; \""his first job in Hollywood was as a double for Clark Gable\"");00899319-a (having two meanings with intent to deceive; \""a sly double meaning\""; \""spoke with forked tongue\"");01388083-a (large enough for two; \""a double bed\""; \""a double room\"");01550993-a (used of homologous chromosomes associated in pairs in synapsis);02224928-a (twice as great or many; \""ate a double portion\""; \""the dose is doubled\""; \""a twofold increase\"");02225139-a (consisting of or involving two parts or components usually in pairs; \""an egg with a double yolk\""; \""a double (binary) star\""; \""double doors\""; \""dual controls for pilot and copilot\""; \""duple (or double) time consists of two (or a multiple of two) beats to a measure\"");02225486-a (having more than one decidedly dissimilar aspects or qualities; \""a double (or dual) role for an actor\""; \""the office of a clergyman is twofold; public preaching and private influence\""- R.W.Emerson; \""every episode has its double and treble meaning\""-Frederick Harrison);02228166-a (used of flowers having more than the usual number of petals in crowded or overlapping arrangements; \""double chrysanthemums have many rows of petals and are usually spherical or hemispherical\"");00247103-v (increase twofold; \""The population doubled within 50 years\"");01412177-v (hit a two-base hit);01528293-v (do double duty; serve two purposes or have two functions; \""She doubles as his wife and secretary\"");01738383-v (make or do or perform again; \""He could never replicate his brilliant performance of the magic trick\"");02067237-v (bend over or curl up, usually with laughter or pain; \""He doubled and vomited violently\"");02305386-v (bridge: make a demand for (a card or suit));00083743-r (to double the degree; \""she was doubly rewarded\""; \""his eyes were double bright\"");00323217-r (two together; \""some people sleep better double\"");00323299-r (downward and forward; \""he was bent double with pain\""

senses.definition: A person of similar size and shape to an actor that "stands-in" for the actor during the lengthy process of setting up a shot, who, unlike a double, does not appear in the film
